amazon.description: Can you see the dark pattern? Where does it hide?
amazon.name: Interesting proposition
amazon.negative: Behind the input field for the email.
amazon.positive: Behind the button to reject the offer.

amazon.description: How do you think this type of dark pattern can be called?
amazon.name: Try to escape

cnn.description: An online news site you don't subscribe to shows a provocative headline, but you can't read the full article. What do you do?
cnn.name: Subscription
cnn.negative: I buy the one-time-right to read the article.
cnn.positive: I do not mind that I can't read the full article, I go to the comments section to read what others think and comment my opinion as well.

gmail.description: You receive a promotional email in your inbox. Do you mark spam emails as junk?
gmail.name: G for gmail

gmail.description: You get a promotional email with a zip. file attachment - it says that there are discount codes for some products - you have to open a file in order to  see how lucky you are today. Would you open the file?
gmail.name: GG

instagram.description: How many dark patterns can you see?
instagram.name: SCROLLLOCK

instagram.description: How can you describe Dark Patterns?
instagram.name: Instakill
instagram.negative: Manipulation by the company or organisation in order to steal data and money from the users bank account.
instagram.positive: Manipulation by the company or organisation in order to benefit agains the users initial needs.

meta.description: You see a game invitation in your inbox on social media. How do you react?
meta.name: A game...
meta.negative: Find out what game it is.
meta.positive: I ignore the invite and do not play the game.

meta.description: The game asks for your credit card details and a subscription to let you play.
meta.name: And the winner is...
meta.negative: I enter my credit card details and play the game.
meta.positive: I do not enter any data and exit the game.

reddit.description: You see a picture of a hated politician in an embarrassing situation. The picture looks fake, but it does not look like a meme. What do you do?
reddit.name: Fake news
reddit.negative: I upvote the post and scroll to the next post.
reddit.positive: I click on the picture and go read the comments to figure out what exactly is going on.

rightAnswer.content: Right answers give you points! That is cool :)
rightAnswer.name: Right answer

wrongAnswer.content: We will count how many times we were right
wrongAnswer.name: Wrong answer

Main.content: Click on anything you want! Find something fun, be creative!
Main.name: Click on things

Main.content: Try to think well before answering but don`t forget to have fun ;)
Main.name: Learn and play

Main.content: Don't forget to break things and leave a feedback how did it go...
Main.name: "Break stuff"
